data.event: In 1882 the national government contracted the local businessman Eduardo Madero to take charge of the construction of a new port which would solve these problems.
Construction began in 1887 and was completed in 1897, although the installed fittings had been partially operative some years before completion of the port.
Construction began in 1887 and was completed in 1897, although the installed fittings had been partially operative some years before completion of the port.
It was a costly project and an engineering landmark at the time but ten years after its completion the appearance of larger cargo ships made Puerto Madero obsolete.
His plans resulted in the "Puerto Nuevo" (New Port), still operating today, whose first section opened in 1911.
